activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Cruz

records.addlTxt:
8:51 AM Defendant Angel Cruz in court.  Attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Interpreter: Reme Bashi Sworn in.
Defendant does not have an attorney yet. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

1:55 PM Defendant Angel Cruz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Angel Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter: Vicki Bermudez previously sworn. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
